entityId.localType: National Archives of Australia Reference Number

nameEntry.part: Aboriginal Inland Mission Retta Dixon Home Bagot - Policy and Development

biogHist.abstract: This digitised file contains correspondence between the Aboriginal Inland Mission (AIM) and various government departments relating to the running of the Retta Dixon Home in Darwin. Subjects covered in the correspondence include recreational activities at the Home, lists of children, staff lists, the accommodation of State Children, purchases, funding and information on the move of the Retta Dixon Home to new cottage style Homes at a new site.
biogHist.p: This record is digitised and 'Open with exception' which means that some parts of the file are open and other parts are not. The open parts are available for viewing through Recordsearch. Information about how to access records through Recordsearch is available on the National Archives website.
